Title: Facing capital market integration for asean economic community, a comparative study between indonesia stock exchange (IDX) and Bursa Malaysia (BMKLCI)
Affiliations: Accounting Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11530, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Evi Steelyana, W., Accounting Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11530, Indonesia; Wirapradja, H.W., Accounting Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11530, Indonesia
Abstract: ASEAN Economic Community 2015 will affect stock markets condition among ASEAN countries. Some macroeconomics factors will give significant impact to stock market in each ASEAN countries. This paper will focus on comparing Indonesia Stock Exchange (IDX) and Bursa Malaysia (BMKLCI) with some development of capital markets during 2010–2013 in several macroeconomic factors such as: Inflation Rate, Interest Rates and Exchange Rates (USD). This study used Quantitative Method with Multiple Linear Regression Analysis and using secondary data from IDX and KLSE. In the end, this paper describes how stock market development condition and what factors are significantly affected most to Composite Stock Price Index in both Capital Market, Malaysia and Indonesia. © 2015 American Scientific Publishers. All rights reserved.
Author Keywords: Asean economic community; Bursa malaysia (bmklci); Exchange rate; Indonesia stock exchange (idx); Inflation rate; Interest rate
